name: Silver Gibbon
description: The Silver Gibbon is a small ape with light gray fur, known for its acrobatic movements and melodic duets.
food_note: Highly arboreal, rarely descending to the ground.
reproduction: Gestation about 7 months, one infant born every 2-3 years.
attractions: Popular in zoos for their agility and vocalizations.
projects_note: Endangered due to deforestation; conservation programs are active.
breeding: Bred in captivity to support population recovery.
